WELCOME TO MY PORTFOLIO

About Me

FRANK KUSI APPIAH

My name is Frank Kusi Appiah. I am a student at Oberlin College, studying computer science. I come from Ghana, where my love for technology began when I was a kid. I used to take apart TV remotes and fix radios just to see how they worked. That curiosity never left me.

As I grew older, I started to notice how the environment around me was changing. There were longer dry seasons, less rain, and farmers were finding it harder to grow enough food. This made me realize how important it is to take care of our planet. That is when I began to care deeply about sustainability.

To me, sustainability means using what we have in a smart way so that we do not run out of it. It means helping people today while making sure that the future is safe and full of possibilities. I believe that technology can help us do that. It can help us save water, grow more food, reduce pollution, use clean energy, and protect nature.

My dream is to build tools and machines that support small farmers, help communities manage clean water, reduce waste, and use energy in smarter ways. I want to create systems that make everyday life better without harming the planet. I believe true sustainability touches every part of life, from food and water to energy and the way we live with the environment. I want to be part of a future where people and nature grow together in harmony. This is the reason I study computer science and the reason I care so much about the work I do.
